item.title: NBA-Shotchart
item.description: An interactive dashboard for NBA player shot data. Built with React, d3-shotchart (https://www.npmjs.com/package/d3-shotchart), a Node.js client for stats.nba.com API endpoints (https://www.npmjs.com/package/nba) and Ant Design (https://ant.design/). The hexbin chart visualizes the frequency and efficiency of shots made on the court. In the hexbin mode, user can filter shots by minimum frequency using the slide bar or input box. Maximum frequency for this filter is 20. The scatter chart visualizes the missed and made shots, while the tooltips display the distance and action type of the shots.

item.title: Tweety Pipe
item.description: A real-time data processor built with Spark and Kafka. Data visualized with a simple Flask app and Chart.js Work Summary Implemented a real-time computer vision program that monitors the availability of homeless shelters in Toronto, using Python, OpencCV and convolutional neural networks. Researched multiple CV frameworks and integrated a centroid tracking algorithm using Numpy to track movements of shelter clients near the entrance, consistently achieving an above-93% accuracy.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Homeless Shelter Occupancy Monitor Tweety-Pipe: A Real-Time Data Processor with Spark and Kafka NBA-Shortchart: An Interactive Visualization Dashboard for NBA player Shot Data AFK, grabbing lunch, more to come!

item.title: Occupancy Monitor
item.description: Code This open source project’s code is not available to the public lives here. Credits this amazing blog from pysource . this amazing blog from pyimagesearch . example tensorflow usage from medium user @@madhawavidanapathirana . pretrained models provided by this: Description Our application: Our application detects and tracks humans from a live or recorded video feed, and keeps track of a counter for the number of times people enter and leave a space.

item.title: Education
item.description: -- University of Toronto, St. George Honours Bachelor of Science Year 4, aGPA: 3.86/4.0 Specialist: Computer Science, Major: Statistics, Minor: Math 09/2016 – 01/2021 Courseworks include: Deep Learning & Neural Networks, Probabilistic Learning, Nonlinear Optimiazation, Operating Systems, Software Engineering, Algorithms & Data Structures

item.title: Work
item.description: -- Activision Blizzard - Demonware Demonware is an Activision Blizzard studio that provides online web services for some of the world’s largest video game franchises. Demonware’s services include matchmaking, in-game purchase, social networking and many more, producing 133,000+ metrics a second and impacting almost half a billion players’ online gameplay experience. Software Engineering Intern Call of Duty Modern Warfare, Warzone, Black Ops Cold War (WATCH THE TRAILER) 05/2020 – present Toronto, ON
